intro: Gadellia lactiflora, commonly known as the milkweed of the genus Gadellia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are usually hairy. Gadellia lactiflora is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
